jparsec.observer

Enum ObserverElement.DST_RULE

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ObserverElement.DST_RULE>
      • jparsec.observer.ObserverElement.DST_RULE
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ObserverElement.DST_RULE>
    Enclosing class:
    ObserverElement

    public static enum ObserverElement.DST_RULE
extends java.lang.Enum<ObserverElement.DST_RULE>
    The set of DST rules. Daylight saving time is usually an hour added between spring and autumn in the north hemisphere. The rule applied in each case when the time used for calculations reaches the 'limit' is as follows:
    1. In case of changing 2h LT to 3h LT in spring (DST changes from 0 to 1), 2h LT to 3h LT does not exists, but you can access this range in JPARSEC and resulting UT is correct (DST still 0).
    2. In case of changing 2h LT to 1h LT in autumn (DST changes from 1 to 0), 1h LT to 2h LT for DST 0 cannot be accessed. >=2h LT will be available for DST 0.
    DST is obtained using UT in TimeScale.getDST(double, ObserverElement).

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      CUSTOM
      Symbolic constant for a custom DST rule.
      N1
      Daylight saving time starts on last Sunday of march and ends on last Sunday of October.
      N2
      Daylight saving time starts on last Sunday of April and ends on last Sunday of November.
      NONE
      No daylight saving time rule or unknown.
      S1
      Daylight saving time starts on last Sunday of October and ends on last Sunday of March of the next year.
      S2
      Daylight saving time starts on last Sunday of November and ends on last Sunday of April of the next year.
      USA_AUTO
      Symbolic constant for USA/CANADA automatic rule selection for DST.
      USA_NEW
      Symbolic constant for USA/CANADA new rule for DST.
      USA_OLD
      Symbolic constant for USA/CANADA old rule for DST.

      • USA_NEW

        public static final ObserverElement.DST_RULE USA_NEW
        Symbolic constant for USA/CANADA new rule for DST.

      • USA_AUTO

        public static final ObserverElement.DST_RULE USA_AUTO
        Symbolic constant for USA/CANADA automatic rule selection for DST. Before 2007 old rule will be applied, in 2007 and after the new one. This is the default behavior and it is not necessary to choose this setting for USA or Canada, although it could be useful if it is necessary to apply the same method in other countries.

      • CUSTOM

        public static final ObserverElement.DST_RULE CUSTOM
        Symbolic constant for a custom DST rule. You will have to set also the start and end fields accordingly (and, optionally, the time offset), using any of the constants provided in this class. The UNKNOWN field should not be used.

    • Field Detail

      • start

        public int start
        Sets the start of DST. Will have effect only for CUSTOM DST rule.

      • end

        public int end
        Sets the end of DST. Will have effect only for CUSTOM DST rule.

      • timeOffsetHours

        public double timeOffsetHours
        Sets the time offset to apply the DST respect 0h UT. Set to 1 to apply the DST at 1h UT, and so on.
